name: Masjid Bandar Diraja Klang, Kland, Malaysia
Japanese Bridge (Chùa Cầu), Hoi An, Vietnam
Chinatown, Singapore
description: Chinatown's physical development began from 1843, when more land leases and grants for homes and trade were awarded – particularly around Pagoda Street, Almeida Street (today's Temple Street), Smith Street, Trengganu Street, Sago Street and Sago Lane.

name: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple, Singapore
description: The Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum is a Buddhist temple and museum complex located in the Chinatown district of Singapore. The temple's monastics and devotees officially practice Chinese Buddhism.

name: HSBC Building, Singapore
description: It stands at 290m (951 ft), exempted from the height restriction of 280m in the Central Business District.
